app.title: Lunar Birthday iCalendar
app.subtitle: Generate iCalendar events for birthdays and anniversaries
app.aboutText: This tool can be used to generate iCalendar (.ics) files containing lunar birthdays, Gregorian birthdays, and anniversaries based on the integer days. All data is processed locally in your browser.

common.resetConfirm: Are you sure you want to reset all configurations? This action cannot be undone.

ical.integerDaysSummary: {name} has been on Earth üåè for {days} days!
ical.integerDaysDescription: {name} has been on Earth üåè for {days} days! (age: {age}, birthday: {birthday})

eventForm.name: Name
eventForm.remindersPlaceholder: e.g. 1, 3 (Leave empty to use global settings)
eventForm.attendeesPlaceholder: e.g. a@b.com, c@d.com (Leave empty to use global settings)
eventForm.errorInvalidDate: Invalid lunar date, please check year or leap month settings

whatIsICal.title: What is iCalendar?
whatIsICal.content: iCalendar (.ics) is a standard file format used for calendar data exchange. It allows you to import calendar events into applications like Google Calendar, Apple Calendar, and Outlook.

howToUse.title: How do I use the generated file?
howToUse.content: You can download the .ics file and import it directly into your calendar app. However, we recommend 'subscribing' to a calendar URL for easier updates. You can host the generated content on GitHub Gist or any Pastebin service.

subscription.title: Why Subscribe instead of Import?
subscription.content: Subscribing via URL allows you to update the calendar events remotely. If you import the file, the events are static and hard to batch delete or update later.

importAdvice.title: Importing Advice
importAdvice.content: If you choose to import the .ics file directly, we strongly suggest creating a separate new calendar (e.g., 'Lunar Birthdays') instead of importing into your main/personal calendar. This keeps your main calendar clean and allows you to easily delete the entire calendar if something goes wrong.
